summary: This is a U.S. Attorney's Office press release announcing the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein on federal charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors. It alleges a multi-year scheme from 2002-2005 involving dozens of underage victims in New York and Florida, where Epstein used employees, associates, and victim-recruiters to maintain a supply of girls for sexual exploitation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor bringing federal charges against Epstein.
Epstein allegedly worked with employees and associates to contact victims, schedule encounters, and facilitate his abuse scheme.
Epstein is accused of sexually exploiting and abusing dozens of underage girls, paying them cash for sex acts.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was federally charged with one count of sex trafficking of minors (max 40 years) and one count of conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors (max 5 years).
The alleged criminal conduct occurred from at least 2002 through 2005, involving dozens of underage victims, some as young as 14.

Epstein allegedly used a scheme where victims were initially recruited for 'massages' that escalated to sex acts, and he paid certain victims to recruit other underage girls, creating a 'vast network.'
The abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences on the Upper East Side of Manhattan and in Palm Beach, Florida.
Epstein allegedly worked with employees and associates who facilitated the scheme by contacting victims and scheduling encounters.
